result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert F Jorgenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is ordered to pay $268 Felony Court costs &  $250 DNA Surcharge, Failure to pay costs/surcharges will result in 20 days jail CS w/Huber
The defendant is ordered to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $420, $225 attorney fee payment was applied, leaving a balance due of $195. Failure to pay Attorney Fees shall result in: 29 days jail CS w/huber & entry of civil judgment. Defendant shall pay the balace of $713 at the rate of $75 a month, starting 07-15-2014.

07-16-2014 The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $168 (final bill)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
[Clerk: MK] (Clerk SF from 12:00pm -end)
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 11:38am. 
Defendant Robert F Jorgenson in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court confirms with Mr. Jorgenson that he is waiving his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts this waiver.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Jorgenson to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on June 16, 2014 by 7:00 pm
--0 days credit for time already served given

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
recess: 12:14 pm
Status conference on June 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:35 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert F Jorgenson in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Laitsch: Do believe case will resolve, but do have some additional information needed from probation. Request matter be reset for additional STC in approximately 2 weeks with possible anticipated plea
DA Happ: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Jorgenson that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect

NEXT: Schedule STC (possible plea/sentencing) 6/6/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Petition and Order for Payment of Attorney fees granted to Attorney Laitsch in the amount of $217.00
Petition for Payment of Attorney Fees and Proposed Order with Invoice
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $203
Status conference on May 23, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 30, 2014 at 01:40 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 8:47 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert F Jorgenson in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Jorgenson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:51 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 4/30/14 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 5/23/14 at 9:30 am - Send notices
Petition for payment of attorney fees submitted by Attorney Laitsch
Preliminary hearing on April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:27 am 
Defendant Robert F Jorgenson in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch. ADA Jeffrey M. Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Laitsch: Was unable to attend pre-trial conference as was tied up in trial on that scheduled date. Would like to have another PTC with ADA Shock and have the Court set for preliminary hearing or STC, whichever the Court deems appropriate. 
ADA Shock informs the Court that he would also like additional pre-trial and then have matter set for preliminary hearing
Court reminds Mr. Jorgenson that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending and of atty fee payments

NEXT: (1) Counsel to have informal pre-trial conference (2) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 4/10/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on March 11, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 26, 2014 at 01:20 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 10:31 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert F Jorgenson in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch. DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:
-Comply with all sex offender reporting requirements
-Booking at JCSD 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 2/26/14 at 1:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 3/11/14 at 9:15 am - Send notices
Initial appearance on February 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Laitsch is appointed//repayment order of $75 a month starting 02-28-2014
